lines.content: * The CommandProcessor class handles the processing and execution of user commands.
* Constructs a CommandProcessor object and initializes a TaskManager.
* Processes and executes the command entered by the user.
* @param userInput The command entered by the user
* This method processes and executes the command that is entered by the user
String[] parts = userInput.split(" ", 2); // Split command and argument
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Invalid deadline format. Use: deadline <description> /by <deadline>");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Invalid event format. Use: event <description> /from <start time> /to <end time>");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please provide the task number to mark.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please provide the task number to unmark.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please provide the task number to delete.");
System.out.println("That is not a valid command.");
* The DeadlineTask class represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a DeadlineTask object with the provided description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline task
* @param by The deadline of the task
* Gets the description of the deadline task.
* @return The description of the deadline task
* Gets the deadline of the deadline task.
* @return The deadline of the deadline task
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A string representation of the deadline task
* The EventTask class represents a task that is an event with a start time and an end time.
* Constructs an EventTask object with the provided description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task
* @param from The start time of the event
* @param to The end time of the event
public EventTask(String description, String from, String to) {
* Gets the description of the event task.
* @return The description of the event task
* Gets the start time of the event task.
* @return The start time of the event task
* Gets the end time of the event task.
* @return The end time of the event task
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* @return A string representation of the event task
* The Storage class handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* This method loads the tasks saved in the storage file
* @return tasks which are loaded from the saved file
System.out.println("Invalid task type found in file: " + line);
System.out.println("Error loading tasks from file: " + e.getMessage());
* This method saves tasks into the storage files
* @param tasks the current tasks needed to be saved
// Create directory if it doesn't exist
System.out.println("Error saving tasks to file: " + e.getMessage());
* The Task class represents a task with a description and completion status.
protected String description; // Description of the task
protected boolean isDone;     // Completion status of the task
* Constructs a Task object with the given description.
* By default, the task is marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task
* Retrieves the description of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Gets the status icon of the task.
* @return The status icon, [X] if done, [ ] if not done
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Includes the status icon and description.
* The TaskManager class manages tasks including adding, marking, unmarking, deleting, listing, and finding tasks.
* Constructs a TaskManager object and initializes a list of tasks.
* Loads tasks from a file if needed.
loadTasksFromFile(); // Load tasks from file if needed
* This function marks the task based on the serial number of task provided by the user
* @param taskNumberStr the serial number of the task entered by user
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after marking a task as done
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after marking a task as undone
* This method adds a task of type Todo along with the description provided, and then saves the task
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after adding a new task
* This method adds a task of Deadline type along with its description and deadline, then saves the task
* @param descriptionAndBy the string containing description and deadline
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after adding a new task
* This method adds a task of event type along with its description and timings, then saves the task
* @param descriptionAndTime string containing description and duration
Task task = new EventTask(parts[0], timeParts[0], timeParts[1]);
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after adding a new task
* This method deletes the task based on its serial number in the list
* @param taskNumberStr The serial number of task to be deleted
saveTasksToFile(); // Call saveTasksToFile after deleting a task
* This method displays the task list for the user
System.out.println("Ok busy guy, Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list");
* This method searches relevant tasks based on the keyword provided
* @param keyword the keyword based on which the search is initated
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
